intro: Vernonia andrangovalensis, commonly known as the Andragonvalens ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Vernonia andrangovalensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
